name: conservatively
content:
conservatively adverb
(TRADITIONALLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not fashionable or modern: I dress more conservatively for the office. He dresses conservatively, usually but not always in a dark suit.
carefully, often in a way that suggests that you do not like change: They continued to run the company conservatively. The drugs are generally safe if used properly and conservatively.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen you're looking for work, dress conservatively.Sorenson lives conservatively, shaped by his faith and humble roots.The scientist in charge of the experiment said the trial will be conducted conservatively and cautiously.
